item.sentence: The infant was able to stand by himself for the first time last week.
item.question: Did the infant stand by himself last week?

item.sentence: Jane and John studied math and history yesterday, but they failed the exams.
item.question: Did Jane and John pass the exams?

item.sentence: The old man amused himself by gossiping with his children and friends.
Hugh took too long to propose, and his girlfriend decided to marry someone else.
The boy who was wearing a blue cap went missing on his way home last week.
item.question: Was the boy wearing a blue cap?

item.sentence: The thief noticed the boy and the girl watching him from the upstairs window.
Bill will quit his job next month to take care of his kids and step-children.
The father of the pretty girl cleaned up the house all by himself last week.
item.question: Did the pretty girl clean the house?

item.sentence: Megan got angry with her boss and sued him for discrimination last month.
The pilot will fly a new airplane to Europe and back beginning next week.
item.question: Will the pilot fly to Europe?

item.sentence: The nurse took care of the old lady who could not take care of herself.
item.question: Could the old lady take care of herself?

item.sentence: Cindy treated herself to a vacation in China and several other Asian countries.
Margo will open bakeries in Chicago and New York after getting a loan next year.
Sarah and her mother had steak, potatoes, and green beans for dinner last night.
The gardener was happy with the flowers, but the owner of the house was not.
item.question: Was the owner happy with the flowers?

item.sentence: Judy cooked in the kitchen, and Richard barbecued outside in the yard.
item.question: Did Richard barbecue in the yard?

item.sentence: The student who was running out of money gave himself a haircut last week.
Julie dated Adam and Andy, but she married Jeff in Las Vegas last month.
item.question: Did Julie marry Adam?

item.sentence: Todd wanted to be a barber, but his shaky hands prevented him from becoming one.
The writer of the novels thought himself to be a genius, but he wasn't.
The cute girl who was on the cover of the magazine became a famous doctor.
item.question: Did the cute girl become a doctor?

item.sentence: The boyfriend of the model was killed in an accident while skiing last week.
Yesterday, the wife of the politician discussed health care with old people.
item.question: Did the politician discuss health care?

item.sentence: The children of the rich man were spoiled, but they were charming and handsome.
item.question: Were the children of the rich man spoiled?

item.sentence: The son of the actress who shot herself on the set was under investigation.
item.question: Was the son of the actress under investigation?

item.sentence: The brother of the bride who embarrassed herself at the wedding felt ashamed.
The uncle of the waitress who hurt herself was shocked by the accident.
The son of the lady who politely introduced herself was popular at the party.
item.question: Was the lady popular at the party?

item.sentence: The brother of the schoolgirl who burned herself was usually very careful.
item.question: Was the brother of the schoolgirl usually careful?

item.sentence: The grandfather of the woman who killed herself last summer had been to prison.
The grandma of the fireman who criticized himself far too often was anxious.
The aunt of the schoolboy who hurt himself was concerned about the injury.
item.question: Was the schoolboy concerned about the injury?

item.sentence: The daughter of the man who complimented himself in public was beautiful.
The sister of the salesman who made a fool of himself at work was very angry.
item.question: Was the sister of the salesman angry?

item.sentence: The daughter of the actor who hated himself for failing always seemed unhappy.
The sister of the prince who injured himself falling off a roof was still sad.
item.question: Was the prince sad?

item.sentence: The son of the princess who scratched himself in public was awfully embarrassed.
item.question: Was the princess embarrassed?

item.sentence: The brother of the ballerina who found himself in a lot of trouble phoned home.
item.question: Did the ballerina phone home?

item.sentence: The nephew of the maid who cut himself with the knife called the doctor.
item.question: Did the nephew of the maid call the doctor?

item.sentence: The grandfather of the policewoman who treated himself so badly was troubled.
The nephew of the queen who praised himself all the time was very rude.
The uncle of the girl who prepared himself for the race was a great athlete.
The grandma of the policeman who educated herself at night became a teacher.
item.question: Did the grandma of the policeman become a teacher?

item.sentence: The niece of the fisherman who got herself a sailboat learned to sail.
item.question: Did the niece of the fisherman learn to sail?

item.sentence: The daughter of the king who devoted herself to the kingdom was never emotional.
The sister of the boy who taught herself advanced mathematics was very smart.
The aunt of the waiter who trained herself to cook wanted to own a restaurant.
item.question: Did the waiter want to own a restaurant?

item.sentence: The niece of the butler who scolded herself for losing the key was very upset.
The nurse examined the mother, and the child played quietly in the corner.
item.question: Did the child play quietly?

item.sentence: The swimmer disappointed her coach, and her mother tried to console her.
The tourist photographed the swimmer, and the runner got ready for the race.
item.question: Did the tourist photograph the runner?

item.sentence: The little girl fed her pet cat, and her dog wanted a can of food, too.
The ranger gave matches to the camper, and his friend made a fire by the tent.
Jim listened to the pianist, and the singer watched the organist at the concert.
item.question: Did the singer listen to the pianist?

item.sentence: The audience applauded the guitarist, and the band cheered for him very loudly.
item.question: Did the audience applaud the guitarist?

item.sentence: The producer replaced the actor, and the actress quit the movie after the fight.
Diane hugged her boyfriend, and her friend felt uncomfortable watching them.
item.question: Did Diane's friend feel uncomfortable?

item.sentence: The woman dressed her baby, and her son got his clothes from the dresser.
The juggler entertained the children, and their parents drank wine at the party.
item.question: Did the juggler drink wine?

item.sentence: The crowd cheered for the model, and the designer took a bow after the show.
The teacher praised the girl and her family was proud of her good grades.
item.question: Was the girl's family proud of her grades?

item.sentence: Bobby yelled at the teacher and the principal asked his parents for a meeting.
The woman could not find Bill and his girlfriend became nervous and upset.
item.question: Could the woman find Bill?

item.sentence: The customer complained about the waiter and the chef gave him a free dessert.
The knight greeted the king and the queen waved to her people at the feast.
The police arrested the burglar and his brother phoned a lawyer for help.
item.question: Was the burglar arrested?

item.sentence: Sam hired the plumber and the carpenter ordered the materials for the house.
The actress yelled at the cameraman and the director hurried out of the room.
item.question: Did the cameraman hurry out of the room?

item.sentence: The journalist criticized Nick and Sam called the newspaper to complain.
item.question: Did Sam call the newspaper?

item.sentence: The robber shot the jeweller and the salesman reported the crime to the police.
Jenny talked to the reporter and the photographer took pictures of the scene.
The witness identified the man and his wife ran away from the police station.
item.question: Did the witness run away from the police station?

item.sentence: Anne will serve the apples she picked yesterday, but she won't serve the plums.
item.question: Will Anne serve the plums?

item.sentence: Robert will meet the friend he phoned yesterday, but he doesn't want to.
David caught the fish he will cook tomorrow, but it is not his favourite kind.
item.question: Will David cook the fish?

item.sentence: Sue insulted the candidate she will debate tomorrow, but she wishes she hadn't.
Jane prepared the lecture she will give next week, but still needs to review it.
Joseph brewed the beer he will serve next week, but it is not very tasty.
item.question: Will Joseph serve the beer?

item.sentence: Tom will plant the tree he bought last week, but he isn't sure where to put it.
item.question: Does Tom know where to put the tree?

item.sentence: Lisa will change the plans she made last week, but she won't cancel any of them.
Jeff planned the party he will hold next month, but he hasn't sent invitations.
Dan wrote the speech he will deliver next month, but he hasn't practiced it yet.
item.question: Has Dan practiced the speech?

item.sentence: Paul will marry the woman he just met last month, but the wedding will be small.
Amy will visit the man she worked with last month, but she is nervous about it.
item.question: Is Amy nervous?

item.sentence: Linda will wear the sweater she washed tomorrow, but she won't wear her skirt.
James will fix the car he drove tomorrow, but he will need some help.
item.question: Did James drive a car?

item.sentence: Mary called the applicant she will interview yesterday, but there was no answer.
item.question: Did the applicant answer?

item.sentence: Mike watered the flower he will sell yesterday, but he forgot to water the bush.
Susan bought the wine she will drink last week, but she didn't buy any cheese.
item.question: Did Susan buy any cheese?

item.sentence: Chris cleaned the bookcase he will sell last week, but it is still very dusty.
Mark will answer the email he got next week, but he doesn't know what to write.
item.question: Will Mark answer the email?

item.sentence: Cathy will burn the wood she gathered next week, but she will save some of it.
Jim painted the picture he will display last month, but he isn't happy with it.
item.question: Did Jim paint the picture?

item.sentence: John hired the clerk he will promote last month, but he fired another employee.
Bob will complete the project he started next month, but Fred won't finish his.
Kim will display the photos she took next month, but she won't show all of them.
item.question: Will Kim show all the photos?
